subject: Automobiles
Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: The three-time champion Sébastien Bourdais won the pole yesterday for Champ Car’s inaugural Dutch Grand Prix, edging Justin Wilson for the top starting spot in Assen, the Netherlands. Bourdais, hoping to become the first Champ Car driver to claim four straight titles, was timed in 1 minute 18.765 seconds around the 2.83-mile Assen track. The pole was the sixth this season for Bourdais, who will move to Formula One next year.
